Rica Rosario Valencia moved this conversation from the Unknown Mailbox inbox

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,


Hope you had a good long weekend.


A new issue has arisen in the automation of loading orders into Pronto. It appears that we cannot have any commas now in the file.


It appears in the address section, where people put in their unit or street number then the street name. I can only think of one solution, it that this field is separated out? But this will add more columns. Or is there another way?


Thanks,
Rosemary


RosemaryMurphy
Marketing Communications Manager


rmurphy@mayohardware.com.au

www.mayohardware.com.au

+61 400 329 380

Customer Service: 1300 360 211

We pride ourselves on the highest levels of service delivery, please feel free to contact me on any of the above methods, anytime.

From: Alma Oribello <aoribello@mayohardware.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 14 June 2022 9:23 AM
To: Leah Mills <LMills@mayohardware.com.au>; Rosemary Murphy <RMurphy@mayohardware.com.au>
Cc: Anne-Marie Van Gestel <avangestel@mayohardware.com.au>; Margaret Renton <mrenton@mayohardware.com.au>
Subject: eCommerce order


Hi Leah,
Attached order didn't come through in Pronto. Please process manually.

Hi Rosemary,
We've had some issues wherein some of the orders didn't get auto loaded in Pronto. I have raised this with Manish our Pronto consultant and he's indicated that the reason for it is having commas (,) on any of the fields. We can not have comma in the text in a CSV ( comma separated file). Can you please advise web developer that we not accept commas in any of the fields on the web portal when customers are placing orders.

Thanks
AlmaOribello
IT Coordinator
